law.catch_line: In order to establish, modify, or enforce a duty of support, the Administration may issue subpoenas ...

text.section: In order to establish, modify, or enforce a duty of support, the Administration may issue subpoenas to compel the production of documents and other tangible items.

A subpoena issued under subsection (a) of this section shall:
specify the name and address of the person to be subpoenaed;
describe the items to be produced with particularity; and
include a return date for the subpoena.

The Administration may serve a subpoena by:
hand delivery; or
certified mail.

If a person fails to comply with a subpoena issued by the Administration, the Administration may:
reissue the subpoena;
exercise the Administration's authority under § 10-119.3 of this subtitle to suspend any license held by the person; or
apply, upon affidavit, to any judge of a circuit court for an order requiring the person to obey the subpoena.

If a person knowingly fails or refuses to obey a court order to comply with a subpoena issued under this section, the court may compel compliance with the administrative subpoena in any manner available to the court to enforce its own order or subpoena.
